study_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for this study

institutionCode.description: The code or abbreviation representing the lead institution responsible for the study.
institutionCode.error: Name or acronym of institution is required

title.description: An official title for the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
title.example: Study of Spatial Transcriptomics related to Fish

description.description: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication
description.example: This project explores the intricate details of spatial transcriptomics in fish.

bibliographicCitation.description: A citation for the study resource, following a standard format.
bibliographicCitation.example: Doe J., et al. (2024). Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Fish. Journal of Biology.

created.description: The date when the study was created or registered.
created.error: Date study was created is required

workflow.description: The workflow or protocol followed during the study.

sample_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study.

study_reference.description: A reference to the study, usually a unique identifier or citation.

strain.description: The strain of the organism, if applicable.

tissue.description: The type of tissue sampled for the study.

preservation_method.description: A brief description of how the sample was preserved.

AgeClass.description: The age class of the organism at the time of collection.

collection_date.description: The date when the sample was collected.

geographic_location_latitude.description: The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. We advise that locations are specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places (https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees).

geographic_location_longitude.description: The geographic longitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180. We advise that locations are specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and maximum of 8 decimal places (https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees).

broad_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
broad_scale_environmental_context.error: Broad scale environmental context is required

local_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
local_scale_environmental_context.error: Local scale environmental context is required

environmental_medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

country.description: The country where the sample was collected.
country.error: Invalid country. Please enter a valid country.

day.description: The day of the month when the sample was collected.
day.error: Invalid day. Please enter a valid day (01-31).

decimalLatitude.description: The latitude of the sample collection site, in decimal degrees.
decimalLatitude.error: Invalid decimal latitude. Please enter a valid decimal latitude.

decimalLongitude.description: The longitude of the sample collection site, in decimal degrees.
decimalLongitude.error: Invalid decimal longitude. Please enter a valid decimal longitude.

family.description: The taxonomic family of the organism.
family.error: Invalid family. Please enter a valid family

genus.description: The taxonomic genus of the organism.
genus.error: Invalid genus. Please enter a valid genus

habitat.description: The type of habitat where the sample was collected.

institutionCode.description: The code or abbreviation representing the lead institution where the sample is held.
institutionCode.error: Name or acronym of institution is required

lifeStage.description: The life stage of the organism when sampled.
lifeStage.error: Invalid life stage. Please enter a valid life stage (e.g., Adult).

materialEntityID.description: A unique unique alphanumeric identifier for the material entity (sample).
materialEntityID.error: Invalid material entity ID. Please enter a valid material entity ID (e.g., MAT-12345).

materialSampleID.description: A unique unique alphanumeric identifier for the material sample.
materialSampleID.error: Invalid material sample ID. Please enter a valid material sample ID (e.g., MAT-12345).

month.description: The month when the sample was collected.
month.error: Invalid month. Please enter a valid month (01-12).

order.description: The taxonomic order of the organism.

recordNumber.description: A unique number assigned to this record.

scientificName.description: The scientific name of the organism.

sex.description: The sex of the organism (if applicable).
sex.regex: ^(Asexual morph|Female|Hermaphrodite monoecious|Male|Sexual morph|Not applicable|Not collected|Not provided)$

taxonID.description: A unique identifier for species or organism studied.

taxonRank.description: The rank of the taxon for this organism.
taxonRank.error: Invalid taxon rank. Please select a valid taxon rank.

year.description: The year the sample was collected.

imaging_protocol_id.description: A unique identifier for the sample used in the study.

platform.description: The platform used to isolate the cells.

instrument.description: The instrument used to isolate the cells.

dissociation_method.description: The method used for dissociating the cells.

dissociation_time.description: The time duration for dissociation in minutes.

dissociation_temperature.description: The temperature at which dissociation is performed in degrees celsius.

dissociation_enzyme_concentration.description: The concentration of the dissociation enzyme.

material_incubation_temperature.description: The temperature at which the material is incubated in degrees C.

material_incubation_time.description: The time duration for material incubation in hours.

lysis_buffer_solution.description: The solution used for lysis buffer.

target_probes.description: The type of probes used to detect and quantify specific RNA molecules in their native spatial context within a tissue or cell.

section_thickness_\u00b5m.description: The thickness of the tissue section in micrometres.

section_thickness_method.description: The method used to measure tissue section thickness.

section_thickness_temperature.description: The temperature at which the section was made.

is_pathological.description: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being abnormal and having a destructive effect on living tissue.

digestion_workflow.description: A link to a workflow describing the digestion protocol in Protocols.io

digestion_time_in_minutes.description: The duration of digestion in minutes.
digestion_time_in_minutes.error: Digestion time in minutes is required

digestion_temperature.description: The temperature at which digestion was carried out.

photobleaching_duration_in_hours.description: The duration of photobleaching in hours
photobleaching_duration_in_hours.error: Photobleaching duration in hours is required

instrument_user_guide.description: The user guide for the instrument used.

instrument_user_guide_revision.description: The revision of the instrument user guide.
instrument_user_guide_revision.error: Instrument user guide revision is required

sample_preparation_guide.description: The guide used for sample preparation.

sample_preparation_guide_revision.description: The revision of the sample preparation guide.
sample_preparation_guide_revision.error: Sample preparation guide revision is required

deviations_from_official_protocol.description: Any deviations from the official protocol. Separate individual deviations with '|'
deviations_from_official_protocol.error: Deviations from official protocol is required

imaging_protocol_ref.description: The name of the file that contains the imaging protocol information.

file_name.description: A filename or file name is a name used to uniquely identify a data file related to the study.

file_type.description: A file type is a name given to a specific kind of file. Commong file types are fastq, gtf, fasta, bam, etc.
